External Factors.question: Describe the relevant general economic and industry conditions such as the competitive environment, supplier and customer relationships, technological developments applicable to the entity, and any changes occurred during the period that might impact the entity’s business.
Is the entity involved in cyclical or seasonal business?

Describe the legal and regulatory framework applicable to the entity and the industry or the sector in which the entity operates and how the entity is complying with that framework (include tax laws applicable to the entity).
Describe the complexity of, or changes in the regulatory environment.
Are there any other communications and/or findings from regulators that have direct impact on audit?
Are there any regulatory factors relevant to the entity’s accounting estimates, including, when applicable, regulatory frameworks related to prudential supervision?
Are there any ESG-related matters affecting the entity’s external environment including industry, regulatory and policy changes?
Are there any changes in the tax legislations, rulings, and/or interpretations of existing tax legislations?

Internal Factors.question: Provide a description of the entity’s business operations, including major aspects of production, distribution, sales, and marketing (how they operate, what they produce, how they sell it, new products, etc.) and changes to the nature or profitability of the products or services offered.
What is the determined functional currency of the entity as per AS 11 – The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates?
Are there any transactions and events or other conditions that may give rise to accounting estimates with relatively high estimation uncertainty?
Describe the ownership and governance structure of the entity and changes, if any.
Describe the types of investments that the entity has made or plans to make, including investments in special-purpose entities.

In the period under audit, did the entity have business acquisitions that individually or in the aggregate affected revenues, total assets, or net income of the acquirer by more than 20 percent on a proforma basis?
Internal Factors.tooltip: Proforma adjustments include the relevant financial information of a business that has been, or is to be, acquired (“acquiree”), or a business that has been or is to be, divested (“divestee”). Proforma financial information is financial information shown together with adjustments to illustrate the impact of an event or transaction on unadjusted financial information as if the event had occurred or the transaction had been undertaken at an earlier date selected for the purposes of the illustration.

Internal Factors.question: Will the engagement team be involving a fair value specialist in the audit engagement?

noteIf.Yes: Document the work performed in relation to the involvement of auditor’s specialists in WP XXXX Specialists.
Document the considerations and procedures for related party relationships and transactions in WP XXXX Related Parties.

Internal Factors.question: Does the entity use one or more service organizations related to one or more significant ABCOTDs?
Internal Factors.tooltip: Service Organisation is a third party that provides services that are part of the user entity’s information systems relevant to financial reporting.

noteIf.Yes: Document our understanding of the service organisations in WP XXX Service Organisations.

Internal Factors.question: Describe how the entity finances its operations and the complexity of or changes in capital and financing structure (sources of funding, noncapital funding, significant investment, etc.).
Describe how the entity develops its long-term and short-term business plans, how it identifies the key business risks it faces, what these business risks are, and their approach to addressing them.
As needed describe any other internal factors affecting the entity.

Accounting Policies.question: Provide a description of the key accounting policies, financial/reporting framework and, if applicable, the reason for any changes in the accounting policies adopted during the current audit. Document any new/forthcoming changes including when they will be adopted by the entity.
Has the entity adopted an early application of a new accounting standard (where permitted by law/regulation) that has a material effect on the financial statements?

noteIf.Yes: Document the provisions permitting early application and include in 'Emphasis of Matter' pursuant to SA 706.

Accounting Policies.question: Was there a tax inspection initiated during the period or is there an ongoing tax inspection?

noteIf.Yes: Document the outcome of any concluded tax inspections and/or potential tax matters raised.

Accounting Policies.question: Describe how the entity develops its current-period plans and budgets and the approval process. Describe the key indicators that the management uses for evaluating financial performance and for taking appropriate actions. (eg. KPIs, key ratios, operating statistics).

As needed, describe any other considerations related to financial reporting requirements and the entity’s selection and application of accounting policies and measurement and review of the entity’s financial performance, including changes occurred during the period.

Other Considerations.question: Were there any unusual or complex transactions or events, including significant transactions, that are outside the normal course of business in the current period?
Has the entity entered into or does it have plans to enter into any unique contractual agreements?
Does the entity have any significant accounting estimates in the current year?

noteIf.Yes: Document our review for the indicators of management bias and judgements in WP XXX Review of estimates.

Other Considerations.question: Does the entity have any key suppliers or customers and if so, what is the relationship with them? Are they identified as related parties?
Where are the entity’s locations that make up a significant percentage of accounting transactions?

Understanding Internal Controls.question: Evaluate whether the management, with the oversight of those charged with governance, has created and maintained a culture of honesty and ethical behavior?
Does the control environment provide an appropriate foundation for the other components of the entity’s system of internal control considering the nature and complexity of the entity?
Do control deficiencies identified in the control environment undermine other components of the entity’s system of internal control?
Is the entity’s risk assessment process appropriate to the entity’s circumstances considering the nature and complexity of the entity?

Document whether we identified any RoMMs that the management failed to identify, and if there were, whether there was an underlying risk of a kind that we expect would have been identified by the entity’s risk assessment process.
Document controls surrounding journal entries, including nonstandard journal entries used to record nonrecurring, unusual transactions or adjustments.

Document our understanding of how the entity communicated financial reporting roles and responsibilities and significant matters relating to financial reporting, including:
- Communications between management and those charged with governance, and between the people within the entity. (eg. Policies and procedures, periodic internal newsletters and presentations, targeted email communications)
- External communications, such as those with regulatory authorities.
Does the entity’s information system and communication appropriately support the preparation of the entity’s financial statements in accordance with the applicable financial reporting framework?

Obtain an understanding of the entity’s control activities relevant to audit, which is considered necessary to assess the risk of material misstatement. This includes:
- Control activities that relate to significant risks;
- Controls that are considered to be relevant in the auditor’s judgement; and
- Controls for which substantive procedures alone do not provide sufficient appropriate audit evidence.
Does the entity have an internal audit function?

noteIf.Yes: Document the entity’s internal audit function’s nature, responsibilities, its organizational status, and the activities performed or to be performed.

Understanding Internal Controls.question: Is the entity’s process for monitoring the system of internal control appropriate to the entity’s circumstances considering the nature and complexity of the entity?
